intro: Senecio coriaceisquamus, commonly known as the thick-leaved groundsels, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features sturdy, succulent leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Senecio coriaceisquamus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
